;;Going them alone: ;The generally accepted 6-month cease rate for someone who tries to give up without motivation, education and also support (so-called 'cold turkey' or simply 'pure willpower') is 10% (5% at 12 months). Don't complicated your chances? I don't attribute you! Let's take a short look at some quit smoking products, drugs and programs...
;
;;Nicotine substitution therapy: ;These products contain patches, gum, e-cigarettes, nasal inhalators and lozenges that contains nicotine. Whilst a lot with smokers (quite rightly) feel there is something odd about a new nicotine addict taking nicotine that will them stop using nicotine (it's a little like telling an alcohol addiction to drink wine rather than beer), manufacturers claim that products can 'double your chances of quitting' versus using almost nothing. But all this does is almost always to take the success speed from 3-5% to 6-10%. People surprised at these inferior success rates, but they're just confirmed by real-world OTC nicotine patch studies from pharmaceutical industry consultants.
;
;;Hypnosis / NLP / EFT: ;while various practitioners make extravagant says about their success fees, these claims don't withstand scrutiny. According to Cochrane's (the 'bible' regarding evidence-based treatments) "We didn't shown that hypnotherapy includes a greater effect on six-month kick the habit rates than other surgery or no treatment".
